Works.Author: Unknown
Works.Description: The Charioteer of Delphi is a Greek sculpture...

Works.Name: Pottery of Musical Scenes
Works.Author: Unknown
Works.Description: The Pottery of Musical Scenes is a Greek ceramic...

Works.Name: Discobolus of Myron
Works.Author: Unknown
Works.Description: The Discobolus of Myron is a Greek sculpture...

Works.Name: Bronze Nike
Works.Author: Unknown
Works.Description: The Bronze Nike is a Greek sculpture...

Works.Name: Doryphoros by Polykleitos
Works.Author: Unknown
Works.Description: The Doryphoros by Polykleitos is a Greek sculpture...

Works.Name: Parthenon
Works.Author: Ictinus, Callicrates, and Phidias
Works.Description: The Parthenon is a Doric temple dedicated to the goddess Athena...

Works.Name: Bronze of Riace
Works.Author: Unknown
Works.Description: The Bronze of Riace are two full-size Greek bronzes of naked bearded warriors...
Works.Museum: National Museum of Magna Graecia in Reggio Calabria

Works.Name: Bust of Plato
Works.Author: Unknown
Works.Description: A bust depicting the ancient Greek philosopher Plato, often considered a foundational figure in Western philosophy.

Works.Name: The Kidnap of Persephone
Works.Author: Unknown
Works.Description: A sculpture depicting the mythological event of Hades abducting Persephone to be his queen in the underworld.

Works.Name: Bust of Aristotle
Works.Author: Unknown
Works.Description: A sculptural portrait of Aristotle, one of the greatest philosophers in history, known for his influence on logical and scientific thought.

Works.Name: Helios Chariot
Works.Author: Unknown
Works.Description: A representation of the sun god Helios driving his chariot across the sky, symbolizing the passage of the sun.

Works.Name: Alexander Sarcophagus
Works.Author: Unknown
Works.Description: The Alexander Sarcophagus is a late 4th century BC Hellenistic stone sarcophagus adorned with bas-relief carvings of Alexander the Great.

Works.Name: Laocoön and His Sons
Works.Author: Unknown
Works.Description: Laocoön and His Sons is a monumental marble sculpture portraying a scene from Greek mythology, depicting the Trojan priest Laocoön and his sons being attacked by sea serpents.

Works.Name: Winged Victory of Samothrace
Works.Author: Unknown
Works.Description: The Winged Victory of Samothrace, also known as the Nike of Samothrace, is a marble Hellenistic sculpture of Nike, the Greek goddess of victory, discovered on the island of Samothrace in 1863.

Works.Name: Frescos of the Villa of the Mysteries
Works.Author: Unknown
Works.Description: The Frescos of the Villa of the Mysteries are a series of vibrant frescoes found in Pompeii that depict a series of initiation rituals into a mystery cult.
Works.Museum: Villa of the Mysteries, Pompeii, Naples

Works.Name: Venus de Milo
Works.Author: Unknown
Works.Description: The Venus de Milo is an ancient Greek statue and one of the most famous works of ancient Greek sculpture, representing Aphrodite, the Greek goddess of love and beauty.

Works.Name: Aphrodite Menophantos
Works.Author: Menophantos
Works.Description: The Aphrodite Menophantos is a Roman copy of a Greek

Works.Name: Bust of Tusculum (Portrait of Julius Caesar)
Works.Author: Unknown
Works.Description: The Bust of Tusculum is one of the most iconic portraits of Julius Caesar, providing a realistic depiction of the Roman dictator.

Works.Name: Bust of Julius Caesar
Works.Author: Unknown
Works.Description: The Bust of Julius Caesar is a marble bust representing Julius Caesar, capturing the authoritative and resolute character of Caesar.

Works.Name: Maison Carrée
Works.Author: Unknown
Works.Description: The Maison Carrée is one of the best preserved Roman temple façades, an exemplar of Vitruvian architecture.

Works.Name: Bust of Socrates
Works.Author: Unknown
Works.Description: The Bust of Socrates is a sculptural bust of Socrates, one of the founders of Western philosophy, known for his contributions to ethics and epistemology.

Works.Name: Portrait of Paquius Proculus
Works.Author: Unknown
Works.Description: The Portrait of Paquius Proculus is a fresco depicting Paquius Proculus, a prominent citizen of Pompeii, shown with his wife.

Works.Name: The Judgment of Paris, Fresco from Pompeii
Works.Author: Unknown
Works.Description: The Judgment of Paris is a fresco that vividly depicts the mythological story of Paris awarding the golden apple to Aphrodite, leading to the Trojan War.

Works.Name: Young Hercules
Works.Author: Unknown
Works.Description: The Young Hercules is a sculpture depicting a youthful Hercules, highlighting his strength and potential in his early years.

Works.Name: The Dying Gaul
Works.Author: Unknown
Works.Description: The Dying Gaul is a Roman marble copy of a Hellenistic sculpture, portraying a wounded Gallic warrior in a moment of agony and defeat.

Works.Name: Young Woman with Stylus and Tablet (Sappho), Fresco from Pompeii
Works.Author: Unknown
Works.Description: A fresco from Pompeii depicting

Works.Name: The Punishment of Dirce, Fresco from Pompeii
Works.Author: Unknown
Works.Description: This dramatic fresco depicts the mythological punishment of Dirce, tied to a wild bull by the sons of Antiope as retribution for her cruelty.

Works.Name: Hercules and Omphale, Fresco from Pompeii
Works.Author: Unknown
Works.Description: A fresco showing Hercules in the service of Omphale, the Lydian queen, where he is often depicted

Works.Name: Helen of Sparta on Her Way to Troy, Fresco from Pompeii
Works.Author: Unknown
Works.Description: A fresco capturing the moment Helen of Sparta is taken to Troy, an event that sparked the Trojan War.

Works.Name: Fayum Portraits
Works.Author: Various
Works.Description: A collection of mummy portraits from the Fayum area in Egypt, remarkable for their realism and vivid depiction of ancient faces.

Works.Name: Dionysus (seated on a throne) with Helios, Aphrodite and Other Gods, Fresco from Pompeii
Works.Author: Unknown
Works.Description: A detailed fresco depicting Dionysus alongside other deities such as Helios and Aphrodite, illustrating a scene of divine congregation.

Works.Name: Laocoon and His Sons
Works.Author: Agesander, Athenodoros, and Polydorus
Works.Description: This famous sculpture shows the Trojan priest Laocoon and his sons being attacked by sea serpents, highlighting the suffering and struggle.

Works.Name: Pont du Gard (France)
Works.Author: Unknown
Works.Description: An ancient Roman aqueduct bridge that crosses the Gardon River in southern France, exemplifying Roman architectural brilliance and utility.

Works.Name: Still Life with Eggs, Birds and Bronze Dishes, Fresco from Pompeii
Works.Author: Unknown
Works.Description: This fresco illustrates a still life scene with eggs, birds, and ornate bronze dishes, showcasing Roman daily life and luxury.

Works.Name: Colosseum
Works.Author: Unknown
Works.Description: The iconic Colosseum, a monumental amphitheatre in the center of Rome, known for gladiatorial contests and public spectacles.

Works.Name: House of Venus, Fresco from Pompeii
Works.Author: Unknown
Works.Description: A fresco from the House of Venus in Pompeii depicting the goddess Venus, showcasing the artistic elegance and detailed craftsmanship of Roman frescoes.

Works.Name: Relief of the Judgment of Paris
Works.Author: Unknown
Works.Description: A marble relief depicting the mythological story of the Judgment of Paris, where Paris is tasked with selecting the most beautiful goddess leading to the events of the Trojan War.

Works.Name: Zeus or Jupiter of Smyrna
Works.Author: Unknown
Works.Description: A grand statue of Zeus (Jupiter), originally from Smyrna, representing the king of the gods in classical mythology, noted for its imposing size and regal posture.

Works.Name: Hercules Strangling a Serpent
Works.Author: Unknown
Works.Description: A dynamic sculpture showing Hercules, the hero of classical mythology, in the act of strangling a serpent, symbolic of his divine strength and heroic deeds.

Works.Name: Aqueduct of Segovia
Works.Author: Roman Engineering
Works.Description: An ancient Roman aqueduct in Segovia, Spain, renowned for its remarkable state of preservation. It originally carried water from the Rio Frio to the city.

Works.Name: Augustus of the Vatican Pio-Clementine Museum
Works.Author: Unknown
Works.Description: A statue of Emperor Augustus, housed in the Vatican's Pio-Clementine Museum, showcasing Augustan propaganda through art.

Works.Name: Venus or Aphrodite of Syracuse
Works.Author: Praxiteles
Works.Description: Attributed to the famed sculptor Praxiteles, this statue is a celebrated depiction of Aphrodite, highlighting classical Greek beauty and divinity.

Works.Name: Trajan's Column
Works.Author: Apollodorus of Damascus
Works.Description: A monumental column in Rome celebrating Emperor Trajan's victory in the Dacian Wars, famous for its spiral bas relief, which narrates the wars' history.

Works.Name: Jupiter or Zeus
Works.Author: Unknown
Works.Description: Statues and sculptures representing Zeus (Jupiter), the king of the gods in Greek and Roman mythology, depicted as a figure of power and authority.

Works.Name: Heracles or Hercules Farnese, Roman copy
Works.Author: Glykon of Athens
Works.Description: A Roman copy of a lost original by Lysippos, this sculpture depicts Hercules in a moment of rest, holding the apples of the Hesperides.

Works.Name: Glykon of Athens, original by Lysippos
Works.Author: Lysippos
Works.Description: Known works by Lysippos include dynamic statues that introduced a new canon of proportions and a greater sense of movement to the depiction of the human body.

Works.Name: Sarcophagus of the Twelve Labors of Hercules
Works.Author: Unknown
Works.Description: A sarcophagus intricately carved with scenes from the twelve labors of Hercules, showcasing the hero's strength and divine challenges.

Works.Name: Athena Parthenos, recreation by Alan LeQuire
Works.Author: Alan LeQuire
Works.Description: A modern full-scale recreation of the Athena Parthenos statue originally crafted by Phidias, placed in the Parthenon in Nashville, Tennessee.

Works.Name: Book of Kells
Works.Author: Unknown
Works.Description: The Book of Kells is an illuminated manuscript Gospel book in Latin, containing the four Gospels of the New Testament together with various prefatory texts and tables.

Works.Name: Lindisfarne Gospels
Works.Author: Unknown
Works.Description: The Lindisfarne Gospels is an illuminated manuscript Gospel book in Latin, containing the Gospels of Matthew, Mark, Luke, and John, along with other texts and decorations.

Works.Name: Sutton Hoo Helmet
Works.Author: Unknown
Works.Description: The Sutton Hoo Helmet is a decorated Anglo-Saxon helmet discovered during the excavation of the Sutton Hoo ship burial, one of the most significant archaeological finds in England.

Works.Name: The Utrecht Psalter
Works.Author: Unknown
Works.Description: The Utrecht Psalter is a ninth-century illuminated psalter which is a key masterpiece of Carolingian art; it is probably the most valuable manuscript in the Netherlands.

Works.Name: The Bayeux Tapestry
Works.Author: Unknown
Works.Description: The Bayeux Tapestry is an embroidered cloth nearly 70 meters long and 50 centimeters tall, which depicts the events leading up to the Norman conquest of England concerning William, Duke of Normandy, and Harold, Earl of Wessex, later King of England, and culminating in the Battle of Hastings.

Works.Name: Speyer Cathedral
Works.Author: Unknown
Works.Description: Speyer Cathedral, officially the Imperial Cathedral
